attributes.title: Clinical Lab and Blood Draw at UWMC-Roosevelt

body.value:
Conveniently located blood draw and urinalysis in the University District

UW Medicine offers five conveniently located blood draw labs in Seattle where UW Medicine patients and the broader community who have received physician’s orders can have their blood drawn and urine collected for various health tests.

Certified and state-licensed phlebotomists and clinical laboratory technicians collect blood, urine and other fluid samples.

The main lab processes the samples and records the results in the patient’s electronic medical record for review by the ordering provider. The provider then communicates the results to the patient.
body.processed:

attributes.title: Vascular and Endovascular Surgery Clinic at Harborview

body.value:
Complete surgical services for patients with vascular diseases

The Regional Vascular Center – Vascular and Endovascular Surgery Clinic at Harborview Medical Center provides the most up-to-date care for patients with vascular diseases, including endovascular or open treatment of aortic aneurysms and dissections, carotid stenosis, hemodialysis access (including fistulas and grafts), bypass surgery and complex endovascular procedures for peripheral vascular disease, and treatment of leg ulcerations resulting from vascular insufficiency.

The clinic has the support of a state-of-the-art vascular laboratory for diagnostic testing and studies of vascular insufficiency disease and is internationally recognized for its fenestrated endovascular repairs (FEVAR).
body.processed:
Complete surgical services for patients with vascular diseases

The Regional Vascular Center – Vascular and Endovascular Surgery Clinic at Harborview Medical Center provides the most up-to-date care for patients with vascular diseases, including endovascular or open treatment of aortic aneurysms and dissections, carotid stenosis, hemodialysis access (including fistulas and grafts), bypass surgery and complex endovascular procedures for peripheral vascular disease, and treatment of leg ulcerations resulting from vascular insufficiency.

The clinic has the support of a state-of-the-art vascular laboratory for diagnostic testing and studies of vascular insufficiency disease and is internationally recognized for its fenestrated endovascular repairs (FEVAR).

attributes.title: Vascular and Endovascular Surgery Clinic at UWMC

body.value:
Comprehensive care for patients with vascular problems

The Vascular and Endovascular Surgery Clinic at UW Medical Center offers a wide variety of diagnosis, treatment and follow-up care for patients with vascular problems.

Our physicians and staff perform medical, surgical and minimally invasive treatments (angioplasty stents, endovascular grafts) to treat various vascular disorders. Among the conditions treated are: Aneurysmal disease (thoracic and abdominal aorta, peripheral vessels), peripheral arterial disease, carotid artery disease, vascular malformations, renal and mesenteric vascular disease, and complex venous occlusive disease (including varicose veins). Branched Thoracic Endovascular Repair (BTEVAR) is a unique service to UWMC, and few other places in the country perform it.
body.processed:
Comprehensive care for patients with vascular problems

The Vascular and Endovascular Surgery Clinic at UW Medical Center offers a wide variety of diagnosis, treatment and follow-up care for patients with vascular problems.

Our physicians and staff perform medical, surgical and minimally invasive treatments (angioplasty stents, endovascular grafts) to treat various vascular disorders. Among the conditions treated are: Aneurysmal disease (thoracic and abdominal aorta, peripheral vessels), peripheral arterial disease, carotid artery disease, vascular malformations, renal and mesenteric vascular disease, and complex venous occlusive disease (including varicose veins). Branched Thoracic Endovascular Repair (BTEVAR) is a unique service to UWMC, and few other places in the country perform it.

body.value:
Advanced, minimally invasive vascular care in North Seattle

The Regional Vascular Center at Northwest Hospital offers a full complement of vascular services, each enhanced by the latest diagnostic and therapeutic technologies available today. With advanced-fellowship training and a multidisciplinary approach to care, this group of surgeons is uniquely equipped to tackle challenging diseases, acute and chronic alike.

Conditions we treat include peripheral arterial disease, claudication, critical lower limb ischemia, chronic venous disease, varicose veins, leg swelling, thoracic outlet syndrome, iliac artery aneurysm, carotid artery disease and stenosis, carotid aneurysm, dialysis access, peritoneal dialysis, fistula creation and maintenance and abdominal/thoracic aortic aneurysms.

We take a minimally invasive endovascular approach to peripheral artery disease. Common procedures we perform include carotid endarterectomy, TEVAR/EVAR (endovascular thoracic/aortic repair), varicose vein stripping, first rib resection, carotid and iliac artery stenting, saphenous vein ablation and fistulograms with angioplasty.

body.value:
Complete vascular diagnostics and care, centrally located

Located across from the main medical center, the Vascular Laboratory at Harborview Medical Center offers a complete range of examinations to aid in the diagnosis and treatment of vascular disorders. The lab is accredited by the Intersocietal Accreditation Commission (IAC), which means it offers vascular testing in extracranial cerebrovascular, peripheral arterial, peripheral venous and visceral vascular.

The laboratory offers a wide variety of examinations, as well as technologists and physicians who have developed expertise in complex testing protocols such as the Ankle-Brachial Index (ABI) test, duplex ultrasound and carotid duplex.

body.value:
Complete vascular diagnostics and care

The D.E. Strandness, Jr. Vascular Laboratory at UW Medical Center offers a complete range of examinations to aid in the diagnosis and treatment of vascular disorders. The lab is accredited by the Intersocietal Accreditation Commission, which means it offers vascular testing in five major testing areas: extracranial cerebrovascular, intracranial cerebrovascular, peripheral arterial, peripheral venous and visceral vascular.

The laboratory offers a wide variety of examinations, as well as technologists and physicians who have developed expertise in complex testing protocols such as renal artery duplex, evaluation of chronic venous insufficiency and pelvic congestion, and follow-up of endovascular aortic aneurysm repair (EVAR).

The laboratory offers a wide variety of examinations, as well as technologists and physicians who have developed expertise in complex testing protocols such as renal artery duplex, evaluation of chronic venous insufficiency and pelvic congestion, and follow-up of endovascular aortic aneurysm repair (EVAR).

attributes.title: Pediatric Trauma and Burn Services at Harborview

body.value:
Specialized care for children with emergency needs

We hope your child never experiences a life-threatening trauma or burn, but if you need us, Harborview Medical Center is here to help.

We offer the highest level of critical care for children with trauma, which often results from car crashes, burns or falls.

As the only Level 1 adult and pediatric trauma and verified burn care center in Washington, Alaska, Montana and Idaho, Harborview serves more than 1,000 pediatric trauma patients each year.

Pediatric specialists and board-certified pediatricians will provide your child with the best care possible, and Harborview partners with Seattle Children’s to provide rehabilitation care when necessary.

attributes.title: Endocrine Tumor Center at UWMC – Roosevelt

body.value:
Advanced endocrine tumor treatments from a top-ranked care team

The Endocrine Tumor Center provides advanced specialty care for patients with benign and malignant disease of the thyroid, parathyroid and adrenal glands at several convenient sites across the Seattle area, including the University of Washington Medical Center, Harborview Medical Center, UWMC-Roosevelt and the Seattle Cancer Care Alliance.

Our multidisciplinary care team of specialists includes top-ranked endocrinologists, surgeons and oncologists working together to provide complex management of each patient’s entire disease process, including long-term follow-up care.

Services offered at our Center include initial diagnosis, treatment and ongoing management of thyroid, parathyroid and adrenal gland nodules, masses, cancers and other conditions.

In addition to providing fine needle aspiration (biopsies) and surgical treatment options, our care team also evaluates elevated calcium levels and coordinates hormonal testing. UW Medicine’s Endocrine Tumor Program is the only program regionally to offer dosimetry for radioactive iodine treatment.

Consult with your care team or call us to determine which location would be best for your medical condition and treatment needs.

body.value:
Unique care services for older adults at Harborview

​The Senior Care Clinic at Harborview provides primary care and consultative services for patients aged 65 years and older who also have a geriatric syndrome such as cognitive impairment, falls and gait instability, frailty or functional decline.

A compassionate, multidisciplinary team provides a range of services including geriatric medicine, psychiatry, pharmacy, nutrition, social work and nursing.

Our staff also provides one-on-one teaching about safety issues relevant to seniors, such as fall assessment and prevention, using medications safely and managing conditions such as hypertension and diabetes. You can request a falls/gait instability consultation, which is available twice weekly at our Falls Clinic.

On the first Friday of each month, from 8 a.m. to noon, the Senior Care Clinic also operates a Healthy Bones Clinic. This clinic provides consultative care and referrals to other disciplines as needed for patients concerned about osteoporosis and other skeletal health issues.

Our mental healthcare professionals provide a range of services including psychiatric consultations, medication management and recommendations for continued psychiatric care. Health education is available also through the Harborview Patient and Family Resource Center.

The care team accepts most major insurance plans. Make your appointment today.

body.value:
Skin treatment and specialized surgery on Roosevelt 

The Dermatologic Surgery Center at UWMC-Roosevelt in Seattle's University District focuses on the diagnosis and treatment of skin cancer, treatment of cutaneous lesions responsive to laser therapy and general dermatological surgery procedures.

Our surgeons and staff are at the forefront of clinical and scientific research of skin treatment and skin surgery techniques. The specialized surgical techniques performed include Mohs micrographic surgery, one of the most effective state-of-the-art procedures for treating skin cancer, as well as excision, electrodesication and curettage.

Once a skin cancer is diagnosed, treatment depends on multiple considerations, including the type of cancer and its location. We will work with you on your individualized treatment options, risks and benefits.

body.value:
Wide-ranging, compassionate dermatology care for the treatment of all skin conditions

The Dermatology Clinic at Harborview Medical Center provides care to patients of all ages. Services include the evaluation, management and education of patients with diseases of the skin, such as acne, dermatitis, keratoses, melanoma, squamous and basal cell carcinoma, psoriasis, pruritus, warts and wounds.

Treatments include dermatological surgery and simple wound care, debridements and dressing changes.

Our social workers help you find community resources, support and financial and emotional assistance. And our patient care coordinator helps you access resources, schedule appointments and address financial and insurance concerns.

Our social workers help you find community resources, support and financial and emotional assistance. And our patient care coordinator helps you access resources, schedule appointments and address financial and insurance concerns.

body.value:
Dermatology treatments for patients with any skin condition

The Dermatology Clinic at UW Medical Center-Roosevelt provides comprehensive dermatological care for patients with various skin conditions.

We evaluate all skin conditions, from general to specialized care, for patients from all age groups. We also have specialized clinics for the evaluation and treatment of hair loss, atypical moles, nail disorders, cutaneous lymphomas, contact dermatitis and dermatology/rheumatology overlap conditions.

Services also include the management and treatment of chronic skin conditions, including phototherapy, and surgical procedures for patients with symptomatic benign and malignant skin conditions, including skin cancers.

attributes.title: Vascular Laboratory at Eastside Specialty Center

body.value:
Comprehensive vascular diagnostic services in Bellevue

The Vascular Laboratory at Eastside Specialty Center offers a complete range of examinations to aid in the diagnosis and treatment of vascular disorders. The laboratory is accredited by the Intersocietal Accreditation Commission (IAC), which means it offers high quality vascular testing in the specialized areas of extracranial cerebrovascular, intracranial cerebrovascular, peripheral arterial, peripheral venous and visceral vascular care.

In addition to providing a wide variety of vascular examinations, the laboratory is staffed by registered vascular technologists and credentialed interpreting physicians from the Division of Vascular Surgery at the University of Washington.
body.processed:
Comprehensive vascular diagnostic services in Bellevue

The Vascular Laboratory at Eastside Specialty Center offers a complete range of examinations to aid in the diagnosis and treatment of vascular disorders. The laboratory is accredited by the Intersocietal Accreditation Commission (IAC), which means it offers high quality vascular testing in the specialized areas of extracranial cerebrovascular, intracranial cerebrovascular, peripheral arterial, peripheral venous and visceral vascular care.

In addition to providing a wide variety of vascular examinations, the laboratory is staffed by registered vascular technologists and credentialed interpreting physicians from the Division of Vascular Surgery at the University of Washington.

attributes.title: Wound Care & Hyperbaric Center at Northwest

body.value:
Award-winning wound care in North Seattle

The Northwest Hospital Wound Care & Hyperbaric Center is dedicated to providing state-of-the-art clinical wound care and hyperbaric medicine. With more than 18 years of experience, this center is one of the longest operating wound care centers in Western Washington. 

While the patient’s primary care provider maintains overall care for the patient, we treat the wound while providing a case management approach that optimizes the continuum of care.  Available services include outpatient, inpatient and contracted nursing home wound consultations.

Any patient with a wound that has not started to heal in two weeks may be a candidate for treatment. Indications for wound therapy may include ulcers (diabetic, ischemic, neuropathic, pressure), venous insufficiency, collagen vascular disease, trauma and surgical wounds and burns. 

The Northwest Hospital Wound Care and Hyperbaric Center has received numerous awards for its high patient satisfaction and healing outcomes.

attributes.title: Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery Clinic at Harborview

body.value:
Complete oral surgery care at Harborview West

The Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery Clinic at Harborview provides comprehensive diagnosis and treatment of a wide variety of problems relating to the mouth, teeth and facial regions. These conditions include impacted teeth, oral pathology, facial trauma, head and neck infections, maxillofacial reconstruction/implants, dentofacial deformities and temporomandibular joint disorders.

The clinic’s general focus is on adult patients, but patients of any age are treated for injuries sustained from trauma or for emergency care. A parent or guardian who can legally give written informed consent must accompany any patient under 18 years of age.

Our clinic staff includes dental assistants, registered nurses and patient care coordinators. Dental assistants complete initial intake, take radiographs, seat the patient and assist other healthcare professionals during procedures. Registered nurses assist with IV sedation procedures and provide patient education. Patient care coordinators help with referrals, general questions and assist patients with scheduling surgeries and procedures.

The full services of UW Medicine are also available for other specialty services or hospitalization.

The full services of UW Medicine are also available for other specialty services or hospitalization.

body.value:
Patient-friendly emergency care in North Seattle

When an injury or medical emergency occurs, the staff at Northwest Hospital & Medical Center is committed to providing personalized, quality emergency care with compassion, dignity and respect. Our team includes board-certified emergency medicine physicians and nurses with advanced cardiac life support, pediatric and trauma training. 

We provide one of the fastest times to treatment in the region for cardiac patients. And to improve stroke patient recovery rates, we offer immediate patient entry into the hospital’s stroke program.

Our emergency department offers 22 private treatment rooms, five trauma/critical care rooms, mobile and bedside patient admissions and a triage room staffed 24 hours a day.

Our emergency department offers 22 private treatment rooms, five trauma/critical care rooms, mobile and bedside patient admissions and a triage room staffed 24 hours a day.

body.value:
Follow-up treatment for patients discharged from the Harborview Emergency Department

The After-Care Clinic at Harborview Medical Center helps you achieve the best possible recovery after you are discharged from Harborview’s Emergency Department.

Our physicians assess patients who require follow-up treatment for many ailments including, but not limited to, hypertension management; newly-diagnosed diabetes; anticoagulation; wound care; orthopedics; general medicine; neurology; and respiratory and cardiovascular diseases. 
We’re also happy to refer you to primary care providers in the UW Medicine clinic system or other community-based clinics.

We’re also happy to refer you to primary care providers in the UW Medicine clinic system or other community-based clinics.

attributes.title: Plastic and Aesthetic Surgery Clinic at Northwest

body.value:
State-of-the-art cosmetic and reconstructive surgery at Northwest Hospital

The Plastic and Aesthetic Surgery Clinic at Northwest Hospital & Medical Center offers state-of-the-art cosmetic and reconstructive surgeries as well as non-operative, office-based aesthetic procedures.

Our board-certified surgeons specialize in breast, facial and body-contouring surgeries along with non-surgical procedures. We offer restoration of form, function and youthful rejuvenation, tailoring the most modern aesthetic and reconstructive surgical techniques to meet the unique needs of each patient.

Patients choose our clinic and its UW Medicine surgeons for comprehensive, individualized care in a private and intimate setting. We believe in providing high quality, cost-effective healthcare that leads to a safe, satisfying and rewarding surgical experience.

State-of-the-art cosmetic and reconstructive surgery at Northwest Hospital

attributes.title: Palliative Care Outpatient Clinic at Harborview

body.value:
Sensitive, family-oriented palliative care at Harborview to improve quality of life

In addition to offering inpatient palliative care services at Harborview Medical Center, the Palliative Care Outpatient Clinic develops a treatment plan that relieves symptoms, pain and stress of a serious illness, regardless of the patient’s age, the stage of their disease or their need for additional care. We also work with those who have ended curative treatments.

Our team helps patients and their families live their best possible life. We’ll connect them to resources they need, including providing home visits on a limited basis. We also help manage the feelings that come with serious illness and help make decisions about complex medical issues.

Our clinic also helps with pain management, making end-of-life decisions and navigating the grief process.

body.value:
Leprosy diagnosis and disease management at Harborview

The Hansen's Disease Clinic provides specialty care for persons with Hansen's disease, also known as leprosy. Our providers have specialized expertise in the diagnosis and management of this condition, which is rare in the United States but more commonly seen in the developing world.

The clinic is open every other Wednesday.
body.processed:
Leprosy diagnosis and disease management at Harborview

The Hansen's Disease Clinic provides specialty care for persons with Hansen's disease, also known as leprosy. Our providers have specialized expertise in the diagnosis and management of this condition, which is rare in the United States but more commonly seen in the developing world.

The clinic is open every other Wednesday.

body.value:
Pre-operative consultations and anesthesia assessments at Harborview

Your surgeon determined that you should undergo a diagnostic or therapeutic procedure. To ensure that you are ready for surgery, you may be referred to the Pre-Anesthesia Clinic for assessment.

Our anesthesiology faculty and nursing staff will work with you to understand your current health status and risk factors to tailor the safest course of anesthesia and pain management before, during and immediately after your procedure.

The pre-anesthesia visit is a good time to ask questions about what will happen on the day of your surgery. To help us provide the highest level of care, please bring with you to your Pre-Anesthesia Clinic visit:

  • A list of all the medicines you take, including times and dosages. It is important for us to know about all the medicines you are taking—you may need to stop taking some of them for a day or more before your surgery. 
  • The results of tests you have had at any other hospital or clinic, especially heart or lung diagnostic testing such as an EKG, stress test, echocardiogram or pulmonary function tests.
body.processed:

body.value:
A full-service, conveniently located optical shop

Eyes on James is a full-service optical shop conveniently located in the heart of Seattle in Harborview's Ninth & Jefferson Building.

A part of UW Medicine Eye Institute at Harborview—one of Seattle's largest and best eye care groups—we’re equipped with state-of-the-art technology and offer a range of comprehensive services: complete eye exams, designer frames, expert contact lens fittings and specialty prescription eyewear.

Our highly skilled professional staff includes optometrists Susan Dini, OD, Tiffany Hollenbeck, OD, and Ashley McCain, OD.

body.value:
Personalized services for cancers and other blood disorders

Located across the street from Harborview Medical Center, the Harborview Hematology/Oncology Clinic consults, evaluates and cares for patients with blood disorders, bleeding problems, hematologic cancer and solid tumors.

Staffed by world-class hematologists, oncologists and other providers, the clinic coordinates a comprehensive care plan for patients throughout their cancer care journey. UW Medicine and Seattle Cancer Care Alliance (SCCA) are recognized every year by U.S. News & World Report as one of the nation’s best.
body.processed:

body.value:
Immediate and intensive psychiatric care for those in crisis

Inpatient psychiatric care is available at the UW Medical Center to people who need immediate and intensive mental health care.

All admissions to our 10-bed UWMC inpatient psychiatric unit are voluntary, meaning patients sign themselves in and can leave voluntarily as long as they are not at imminent risk of hurting themselves or others. During your stay, you receive a thorough assessment and comprehensive treatment developed by a multidisciplinary team of medical experts who specialize in psychiatric care -- including social workers, occupational therapists, nurses, psychiatrists, psychologists, medical students and psychiatric residents in training.

Every patient is assigned a personal treatment team and plan, and most patients are admitted following an assessment at UWMC, Harborview Medical Center or other emergency departments.

Referrals are required. Referrals are accepted from Washington, Alaska and Montana, as well as from psychiatrists in other regional mental health centers. Referrals are customarily screened by a nurse manager who acquires approval of insurance carriers to assure that hospitalization at UWMC is covered.

Please note: Patients must first go to an emergency room and be evaluated before they can be admitted to the inpatient psychiatry unit. The unit is staffed 24 hours a day. Visiting hours are 12:00 p.m. - 8:00 p.m. (except when the patient is in a treatment group during those times).

If you or a loved one is experiencing a psychiatric emergency, please call 911 or visit the emergency care location closest to you.
body.processed:
Immediate and intensive psychiatric care for those in crisis

Inpatient psychiatric care is available at the UW Medical Center to people who need immediate and intensive mental health care.

All admissions to our 10-bed UWMC inpatient psychiatric unit are voluntary, meaning patients sign themselves in and can leave voluntarily as long as they are not at imminent risk of hurting themselves or others. During your stay, you receive a thorough assessment and comprehensive treatment developed by a multidisciplinary team of medical experts who specialize in psychiatric care -- including social workers, occupational therapists, nurses, psychiatrists, psychologists, medical students and psychiatric residents in training.

Every patient is assigned a personal treatment team and plan, and most patients are admitted following an assessment at UWMC, Harborview Medical Center or other emergency departments.

Referrals are required. Referrals are accepted from Washington, Alaska and Montana, as well as from psychiatrists in other regional mental health centers. Referrals are customarily screened by a nurse manager who acquires approval of insurance carriers to assure that hospitalization at UWMC is covered.

Please note: Patients must first go to an emergency room and be evaluated before they can be admitted to the inpatient psychiatry unit. The unit is staffed 24 hours a day. Visiting hours are 12:00 p.m. - 8:00 p.m. (except when the patient is in a treatment group during those times).

If you or a loved one is experiencing a psychiatric emergency, please call 911 or visit the emergency care location closest to you.

attributes.title: Mental Health and Addiction Services at Harborview

body.value:
Comprehensive mental health care services at Harborview

Located three blocks from the main hospital at Harborview Medical Center, Mental Health and Addictions Services (HMHAS) at Harborview provides integrated mental health and chemical dependency services in an outpatient setting.

Services include crisis intervention, psychiatric evaluation, psychotherapy, group treatment, case management, and geriatric psychiatry services, as well as treatment for individuals for co-occurring chemical dependency and mental health disorders and patients with comorbid medical issues.

Our dedicated staff includes board-certified psychiatrists, psychiatric residents, primary care physicians, nurses, case managers, peer support specialists, master’s level therapists and chemical dependency professionals.
body.processed:
Comprehensive mental health care services at Harborview

Located three blocks from the main hospital at Harborview Medical Center, Mental Health and Addictions Services (HMHAS) at Harborview provides integrated mental health and chemical dependency services in an outpatient setting.

Services include crisis intervention, psychiatric evaluation, psychotherapy, group treatment, case management, and geriatric psychiatry services, as well as treatment for individuals for co-occurring chemical dependency and mental health disorders and patients with comorbid medical issues.

Our dedicated staff includes board-certified psychiatrists, psychiatric residents, primary care physicians, nurses, case managers, peer support specialists, master’s level therapists and chemical dependency professionals.

body.value:
Emergency psychiatric care for those in in crisis

Acute psychiatric services are provided at Psychiatric Emergency Services (PES) at Harborview Medical Center, the county hospital for King County. The PES is a separate unit within the Emergency Room at Harborview staffed 24/7 by a multidisciplinary team consisting of psychiatrists, nurse practitioners, and nurses with support from social workers and chemical dependency counselors.
body.processed:
Emergency psychiatric care for those in in crisis

Acute psychiatric services are provided at Psychiatric Emergency Services (PES) at Harborview Medical Center, the county hospital for King County. The PES is a separate unit within the Emergency Room at Harborview staffed 24/7 by a multidisciplinary team consisting of psychiatrists, nurse practitioners, and nurses with support from social workers and chemical dependency counselors.

body.value:
A conduit for acute and ongoing mental health care recommendations on Roosevelt

The psychiatrists and psychologists at the Outpatient Psychiatry Clinic at UWMC-Roosevelt assist UW Medicine providers in caring for patients with psychiatric disorders. Clinical psychiatrists generally see patients for a one-time consultation to determine diagnosis and recommend treatment. We do not offer ongoing management of psychiatric medications.

The Roosevelt clinic is a primary training site for psychiatry and psychology residents. Residents offer time-limited, evidence-based psychotherapies to address depression, anxiety, panic, trauma and PTSD and insomnia. We don’t offer dialectical behavioral therapy (DBT) or psychotherapy for the treatment of substance use disorders or eating disorders. Psychiatry and psychology faculty oversee trainees through a variety of means including discussion of cases, video recording and review of sessions and in-person involvement in patient visits.

We offer consultation and treatment for women with mental health conditions who are pregnant, considering becoming pregnant or have recently given birth. Services include preconception counseling regarding management of psychiatric disorders during pregnancy, help for patients in making informed decisions regarding treatment of psychiatric disorders during pregnancy and lactation, and medication management and psychotherapy for psychiatric disorders during pregnancy and lactation.

We do not provide services related to court orders, mandated evaluations, disability evaluations or labor and industry-mandated evaluations.

The Roosevelt clinic is a primary training site for psychiatry and psychology residents. We don’t offer dialectical behavioral therapy (DBT) or psychotherapy for the treatment of substance use disorders or eating disorders. Psychiatry and psychology faculty oversee trainees through a variety of means including discussion of cases, video recording and review of sessions and in-person involvement in patient visits.

body.value:
Emergency, trauma and burn care at Harborview Medical Center

​The Emergency & Trauma Center at Harborview Medical Center, located in First Hill near downtown Seattle, is staffed by board-certified emergency medicine physicians and highly trained emergency nurses who provide compassionate and expert adult and pediatric emergency care for all in need, 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.  

As the only Level I adult and pediatric trauma and verified burn center in Washington, Alaska, Montana and Idaho, and the first certified comprehensive stroke center in Washington, Harborview’s Emergency Department is staffed and resourced to care for patients of all ages with all types of critical physical and mental illness, injury or crisis with ready access to a wide range of specialists.

Harborview’s Level I designation, issued by the Washington State Department of Health, recognizes that Harborview consistently meets stringent care standards and has the resources and expertise to care for seriously ill or injured patients, from resuscitation through rehabilitation.

As a Level I trauma center, Harborview also provides leadership in injury prevention programs, teaching, community outreach and education.
body.processed:
Emergency, trauma and burn care at Harborview Medical Center

As the only Level I adult and pediatric trauma and verified burn center in Washington, Alaska, Montana and Idaho, and the first certified comprehensive stroke center in Washington, Harborview’s Emergency Department is staffed and resourced to care for patients of all ages with all types of critical physical and mental illness, injury or crisis with ready access to a wide range of specialists.

Harborview’s Level I designation, issued by the Washington State Department of Health, recognizes that Harborview consistently meets stringent care standards and has the resources and expertise to care for seriously ill or injured patients, from resuscitation through rehabilitation.

As a Level I trauma center, Harborview also provides leadership in injury prevention programs, teaching, community outreach and education.

body.value:
Diagnostic assessment and short-term stabilization 

Inpatient psychiatric care is available at Harborview to people who need immediate and intensive mental health care. Staffed by an interdisciplinary team of physicians, nurses, social workers, chemical dependency counselors, pharmacists, recreational therapists and occupational therapists and peer support specialists, we offer both voluntary and involuntary admissions for people experiencing a broad range of severe and persistent psychotic and mood disorders, substance use disorders and personality disorders.

Please note: Patients must first go to an emergency room and be evaluated before they can be admitted to the inpatient psychiatry unit. The unit is staffed 24 hours a day. Visiting hours are 8:30 a.m. - 8:00 p.m.

If you or a loved one is experiencing a psychiatric emergency, please call 911 or visit the emergency care location closest to you.

If you or a loved one is experiencing a psychiatric emergency, please call 911 or visit the emergency care location closest to you.

attributes.title: Advanced Manual Therapy and Sports Rehabilitation at Ballard

body.value:
Comprehensive sports, orthopedic and manual therapy in Ballard

Advanced Manual Therapy and Sports Rehabilitation in Seattle’s Ballard neighborhood is a premier orthopedic physical therapy facility that offers the highest quality care and treatment to patients in the greater Seattle area. Our team of sports, orthopedic and manual therapy specialists offer leading-edge skills in assessment and evidence-based, individualized treatment planning.

We work to address your goals – whether you want to return to work, get back to playing competitive sports or simply get through daily life. Our team is passionate about helping you achieve a complete and successful recovery.
body.processed:
Comprehensive sports, orthopedic and manual therapy in Ballard

Advanced Manual Therapy and Sports Rehabilitation in Seattle’s Ballard neighborhood is a premier orthopedic physical therapy facility that offers the highest quality care and treatment to patients in the greater Seattle area. Our team of sports, orthopedic and manual therapy specialists offer leading-edge skills in assessment and evidence-based, individualized treatment planning.

We work to address your goals – whether you want to return to work, get back to playing competitive sports or simply get through daily life. Our team is passionate about helping you achieve a complete and successful recovery.

body.value:
Healing physical and occupational therapies for patients recovering from injury and surgery

Our team of orthopedic, hand, pelvic health (for women and men), sports, geriatric and vestibular specialists at the Exercise Training Center at UW Medical Center-Roosevelt helps patients recover from a wide range of musculoskeletal injuries, surgeries and conditions. These may involve the neck, back, hand, wrist, elbow, shoulder, ankle, knee and hip.

The team also has expertise in circus, gymnastic, acrobatic and performance injuries, fall prevention, balance improvement, vestibular rehabilitation and overuse syndromes, as well as in therapies involving Pilates, Tai Chi and yoga. The team is honored to include nationally recognized clinicians in hand therapy, shoulder injuries and pelvic health who work in close collaboration with your team of medical and surgical specialists.

Optimizing your health and ability to move are important components of the services we offer. Our clinicians offer leading-edge skills and knowledge in assessment and evidence-based, individualized treatment planning.

attributes.title: Hand & Elbow Center at Northwest Primary and Specialty Care North Seattle

body.value:
Treatment for complex injuries and chronic conditions

Located in North Seattle, the Hand & Elbow Center at Northwest Primary and Specialty Care North Seattle treats sports injuries and helps you manage arthritis and occupational conditions such as carpal tunnel syndrome.

Our board-certified orthopedic and plastic surgeons, rehabilitation medicine physicians and physical and occupational therapists work together to help you return to full function so you can get back to the activities you love.

We offer a wide range of diagnostic capabilities and procedures in one convenient office.

Treatment for complex injuries and chronic conditions

Our board-certified orthopedic and plastic surgeons, rehabilitation medicine physicians and physical and occupational therapists work together to help you return to full function so you can get back to the activities you love.

We offer a wide range of diagnostic capabilities and procedures in one convenient office.

attributes.title: Physical Therapy and Hand Therapy Clinic at Harborview

body.value:
Physical and hand therapy for patients with musculoskeletal injuries and/or conditions

The Physical and Hand Therapy Clinic at Harborview Medical Center offers top-notch care to patients with a wide range of musculoskeletal and orthopedic injuries or issues. We have skilled and experienced therapists who will evaluate your condition and develop a treatment plan to work towards your goals.

Our physical therapists work with patients after injury or surgery of the neck, back, shoulder, hip and knee. We treat patients with balance issues and work on fall prevention. We have skilled and experienced therapists who specialize in foot and ankle injuries and therapists with expertise in pelvic floor rehab for women and men.

Our certified hand therapists work with patients who have had upper extremity trauma, as well as patients with elbow, wrist and hand pain or repetitive stress injuries.

A referral from your medical provider is required for therapy care in this clinic. Please request a referral from your provider so that we may help you initiate care.
body.processed:
Physical and hand therapy for patients with musculoskeletal injuries and/or conditions

We have skilled and experienced therapists who will evaluate your condition and develop a treatment plan to work towards your goals.

Our physical therapists work with patients after injury or surgery of the neck, back, shoulder, hip and knee. We treat patients with balance issues and work on fall prevention. We have skilled and experienced therapists who specialize in foot and ankle injuries and therapists with expertise in pelvic floor rehab for women and men.

Our certified hand therapists work with patients who have had upper extremity trauma, as well as patients with elbow, wrist and hand pain or repetitive stress injuries.

A referral from your medical provider is required for therapy care in this clinic. Please request a referral from your provider so that we may help you initiate care.

body.value:
Comprehensive treatment, rehabilitation and therapy for patients with major illness or injury

The Rehabilitation Medicine Clinic at UW Medical Center provides comprehensive care for patients with complex or long-term consequences of a major illness or injury.

We assist patients with physical and cognitive problems and a range of conditions, including stroke, spinal cord injury, brain injury, cerebral palsy, muscular dystrophy, amputations, post-polio, cancer-related disabilities including neuro-oncology; pain and neurological disorders; and musculoskeletal disorders.

We also evaluate for outpatient physical, occupational and speech therapy, prosthetics and orthotics, assistive technology and social work services, as well as perform neuropsychological testing and pharmacological management. We offer follow-up care for UW Medical Center inpatients discharged from rehabilitation programs and coordinate outpatient rehabilitation and exercise programs.
body.processed:
Comprehensive treatment, rehabilitation and therapy for patients with major illness or injury

The Rehabilitation Medicine Clinic at UW Medical Center provides comprehensive care for patients with complex or long-term consequences of a major illness or injury.

We assist patients with physical and cognitive problems and a range of conditions, including stroke, spinal cord injury, brain injury, cerebral palsy, muscular dystrophy, amputations, post-polio, cancer-related disabilities including neuro-oncology; pain and neurological disorders; and musculoskeletal disorders.

We also evaluate for outpatient physical, occupational and speech therapy, prosthetics and orthotics, assistive technology and social work services, as well as perform neuropsychological testing and pharmacological management. We offer follow-up care for UW Medical Center inpatients discharged from rehabilitation programs and coordinate outpatient rehabilitation and exercise programs.

attributes.title: Multiple Sclerosis Center at Northwest Hospital

body.value:
Award-winning, team-based services for MS patients nationwide

The UW Medicine Multiple Sclerosis Center at Northwest Hospital in Seattle is an award-winning specialty center where a team of expert providers addresses patients’ individual needs, including accurate diagnosis, differentiation of MS from other mimicking conditions (for instance, neuromyelitis optica, optic neuritis, transverse myelitis), treatment, rehabilitation and symptom management for optimal outcome and well-being.

Our team consists of neurologists, a rehabilitation physician, rehabilitation psychologists, a nurse practitioner, a vocational counselor, a social worker, MS-trained nurses, infusion nurses and a pharmacist. Patients also have access to UW Medicine professionals in other subspecialties, such as neuropsychology, physical and occupational therapy and nutrition. Our facility includes an on-site, dedicated infusion suite and pharmacy as well as on-site MRI that facilitates same-day imaging for patients with urgent symptoms or traveling long distances.

Our center has been an NIH-funded, national leader in multiple sclerosis research for over 40 years, and patients interested in research routinely have the opportunity to participate in clinical studies. The MS Center also trains future leaders in multiple sclerosis care through its physician fellowship program.

Award-winning, team-based services for MS patients nationwide

Our team consists of neurologists, a rehabilitation physician, rehabilitation psychologists, a nurse practitioner, a vocational counselor, a social worker, MS-trained nurses, infusion nurses and a pharmacist. Patients also have access to UW Medicine professionals in other subspecialties, such as neuropsychology, physical and occupational therapy and nutrition. Our facility includes an on-site, dedicated infusion suite and pharmacy as well as on-site MRI that facilitates same-day imaging for patients with urgent symptoms or traveling long distances.

The MS Center also trains future leaders in multiple sclerosis care through its physician fellowship program.

attributes.title: Comprehensive Outpatient Rehabilitation Program at Harborview

body.value:
Complete outpatient rehabilitation for people with neurological disorders and injuries

The Comprehensive Outpatient Rehabilitation Program (CORP) at Harborview Medical Center offers coordinated, interdisciplinary evaluations and therapies for outpatients with a variety of neurological disorders such as traumatic brain injury, stroke, aneurysm, tumors and spinal cord injury. We also work closely with the Rehab Medicine Amputee Clinic, providing specialized training in prosthetic use for upper and lower extremity injuries.

Our services include occupational therapy, physical therapy, rehabilitation counseling, clinical psychology/neuropsychology, speech pathology and therapeutic recreation.

Patient care is directed by a board-certified rehabilitation physician and coordinated by our patient care coordinator. CORP patients are seen in the Rehabilitation Medicine Clinic by the physician as needed throughout the course of their outpatient therapy program.  The rehab team doesn’t just treat your condition, we help you get back to your life.

A referral from your medical provider is required for therapy care in this clinic. Please request a referral from your provider so that we may help you initiate care.

attributes.title: Outpatient Rehabilitation Therapy Clinic at UWMC

body.value:
Outpatient physical, occupational and speech language services treating neurological conditions, injuries

The Outpatient Rehabilitation Therapy Clinic at UW Medical Center treats people ages 17 and older with functional impairments resulting from various neurologic conditions, including traumatic brain injury, stroke, tumor and ALS.

Our services include speech pathology for improving communication, memory, attention and other cognitive skills, and occupational and physical therapy for improving independent daily tasks like meal preparation, household management, balance, ambulation, dizziness, flexibility and strength; and mental health care services and rehabilitation psychology.

Our team focuses on making you more independent at home and returning you to productive activities, like work or school. Treatment addresses cognitive, physical and emotional/behavioral changes through individual and, in some cases, group formats.

Outpatient physical, occupational and speech language services treating neurological conditions, injuries

Our team focuses on making you more independent at home and returning you to productive activities, like work or school. Treatment addresses cognitive, physical and emotional/behavioral changes through individual and, in some cases, group formats.

attributes.title: Physical and Occupational/Hand Therapy Services at Eastside Specialty Center

body.value:
Patient-centered care on the Eastside to help you get back to daily life

UW Medicine Physical and Occupational Therapy Services at Eastside Specialty Center provide patient-centered care to help you return to activities that are essential to your daily life, including activities at home and/or outside the home that you enjoy and are important to your well-rounded life. Many musculoskeletal issues are resolved or improved with graded return to movement and exercise aided by evidenced-based therapeutic interventions done by a therapist.

Our team consists of highly experienced physical, occupational and hand therapy clinicians that examine and evaluate your needs and provide a detailed plan on how to achieve your goals.

The clinic includes orthopedic outpatient physical therapy, and post-surgical physical, occupational and hand therapy. Our practitioners specialize in physical and occupational therapy interventions that address specialized issues like vestibular dysfunction, vertigo, BPPV, pelvic health for women and men, and chronic pain.

attributes.title: Physical Therapy Clinic at the Sports Medicine Center at Husky Stadium

body.value:
Comprehensive sports, orthopedic and manual therapy for the athlete of any level

Our team of sports and orthopedic specialty physical therapy providers work with you to maximize your recovery after musculoskeletal/orthopedic injury or surgery to bring you back to your fullest potential.

After careful evaluation and defining personal goals, we will partner with you to lay out a comprehensive physical therapy program. Knowing your recovery will continue after your physical therapy treatments end, these expert therapists help map out the long-term full return to sports or other desired activity.

The physical therapy staff here offers strong skills, expertise and experience in areas including injury prevention; recovery from ACL and other knee injury or surgeries; hip, shoulder, neck and back injuries or surgeries. They offer expertise in returning to running, hiking, cycling, golf, soccer, baseball, football, track and gymnastics either to prevent injury or after injury occurs. Specialty services include professional bike fits, running evaluations, anti-gravity treadmill (Alter-G), golf and other rotational sport swing/mechanical evaluations.

If this is a new condition or if it’s been more than 45 days since you’ve seen your physical therapist, you may need a new referral or a new evaluation. Please contact the clinic if you have any questions prior to making your appointment.

(The clinic is closed on some Saturdays during Husky football home game days.)

body.value:
Certified hand therapists for a wide range of needs in North Seattle

The Northwest Hand Therapy program at Northwest Hospital provides a wide range of treatments to patients with either hand therapy or physical therapy needs. Our skilled occupational therapy staff works with patients with pain or injury in the arm, forearm, wrist and hand, as well as musculoskeletal injuries or pain, sports injuries and chronic conditions, such as arthritis, diabetes or fall risk.

Certified hand therapists (CHTs) work with patients who have had upper extremity trauma, as well as patients with elbow, wrist or hand pain or repetitive stress injuries. Our therapists work closely with hand surgeons to provide the highest quality post-surgical rehabilitation.

Certified hand therapists for a wide range of needs in North Seattle

Our skilled occupational therapy staff works with patients with pain or injury in the arm, forearm, wrist and hand, as well as musculoskeletal injuries or pain, sports injuries and chronic conditions, such as arthritis, diabetes or fall risk.

Certified hand therapists (CHTs) work with patients who have had upper extremity trauma, as well as patients with elbow, wrist or hand pain or repetitive stress injuries. Our therapists work closely with hand surgeons to provide the highest quality post-surgical rehabilitation.

body.value:
State-of-the-art treatment options and individualized breast care in North Seattle

The UW Medicine Breast Clinic at Northwest Hospital offers thorough and concise evaluations of breast abnormalities and screening plans for people at higher-than-average risk for breast cancer.

We treat benign breast problems, as well as breast cancer, and work with each patient to offer personalized treatment plans based on the type and stage of the disease, genetics, life circumstances and other factors unique to the individual.

Our care team consists of nationally recognized healthcare professionals with extensive clinical knowledge and surgical expertise to diagnose and treat breast disease and breast cancer.

attributes.title: Hand, Elbow & Shoulder Center at Harborview

body.value:
Complete care from your fingertips to your shoulders in the heart of Seattle

Located in the Ninth & Jefferson building across from Harborview Medical Center, the Hand, Elbow & Shoulder Center treats complex injuries and musculoskeletal, peripheral nerve and skin conditions.

Our board-certified, experienced orthopedic and plastic surgeons, rehabilitation medicine physicians and physical and occupational therapists work hard to return you to full function and to get you back to enjoying the activities you love.

​We work closely with colleagues in rheumatology, neurology and other areas, but we always keep you, the patient, at the center of the team.

​We work closely with colleagues in rheumatology, neurology and other areas, but we always keep you, the patient, at the center of the team.

body.value:
Specialized physical and emotional care for older adults

Geropsychiatry is a specialized area of medicine that focuses on the unique physical and emotional needs of the senior adult. These unique issues include loss and adjustments in lifestyle, many times complicated by medical problems. This combination of problems is not experienced by any other age group.

The Geropsychiatric Center at Northwest Hospital is the most comprehensive psychiatric program for senior adults offered in Washington state, providing both inpatient and outpatient care.

attributes.title: Hip & Knee Center at Northwest Primary and Specialty Care North Seattle

body.value:
Expert care in north Seattle for hip and knee conditions

When you need expert joint repair, replacement and treatment services, the Hip & Knee Center at Northwest Primary and Specialty Care North Seattle is one of the region’s best choices.

Our team of fellowship-trained, board-certified UW Medicine orthopedic surgeons has performed thousands of hip and knee replacements, geriatric fracture repairs and other procedures – all with excellent outcomes. After surgery, you’ll receive comprehensive rehabilitation therapy from licensed physical and occupational therapists.

Our goal is to help you regain the active lifestyle you enjoy.

body.value:
Comprehensive hip and knee care in Seattle’s University District

Located in the Seattle’s University District, The Hip & Knee Center at UW Medical Center-Roosevelt provides comprehensive orthopedic and musculoskeletal care with an emphasis on returning patients to normal life activities.

We perform total joint replacements—both primary and revision—as well as corrective osteotomies. Our services and care include: minimally invasive replacement surgery; management of complex total joint problems, such as revision, infection and fracture; developmental hip dysplasia; knee arthroscopy; surgical management of hip impingement; realignment of knee structure; and meniscus tears.

Comprehensive hip and knee care in Seattle’s University District

Located in the Seattle’s University District, The Hip & Knee Center at UW Medical Center-Roosevelt provides comprehensive orthopedic and musculoskeletal care with an emphasis on returning patients to normal life activities.

We perform total joint replacements—both primary and revision—as well as corrective osteotomies. Our services and care include: minimally invasive replacement surgery; management of complex total joint problems, such as revision, infection and fracture; developmental hip dysplasia; knee arthroscopy; surgical management of hip impingement; realignment of knee structure; and meniscus tears.
